input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Create Main Frame
This wrapper creates ‘Main Frame’ record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-main-frame</operation-name> <model> <keys> <configuration-item> <value>MF0020</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> </keys> <instance> <device> <configuration-item> <value>MF0020</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <vendor> <value>Vendor</value> <type>String</type> </vendor> <parent-device> <value>parent device</value> <type>String</type> </parent-device> <model> <value>model</value> <type>String</type> </model> <serial-number> <value>Serial Number</value> <type>String</type> </serial-number> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <configuration-item-type> <value>mainframe</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item-type> <updated-by> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <contact-name> <value>Contact Name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <part-number> <value>Part Number</value> <type>String</type> </part-number> <status> <value>status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <configuration-item-sub-type> <value>Host CPU</value> <type>string</type> </configuration-item-sub-type> <location-code> <value>location code</value> <type>String</type> </location-code> <building> <value>building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <floor> <value>floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <room> <value>room</value> <type>String</type> </room> <system-down> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </system-down> <asset-tag> <value>asset tag</value> <type>String</type> </asset-tag> <critical> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </critical> <company> <value>comapany</value> <type>String</type> </company> <department> <value>department</value> <type /> </department> <assignment-group> <value>assignment-group</value> <type>String</type> </assignment-group> <addl> <type>Array</type> <addl> <element> <type>Structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl description</value> <type>String</type> </addl-description> </element> <element> <type>Structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl manufacturer2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl <type>String</type> </support-contact-first> <support-contact-last> <value>support contact last1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-last> <support-contact-phone> <value>support contact <type>decimal</type> </feature-size> <feature-description> <value>feature description</value> <type>String</type> </feature-description> </element> </features> </features> </device>
<main-frame> <type>Structure</type> <configuration-item> <value>MF0020</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <alternate> <type>Array</type> <alternate> <element> <type>Structure</type> <alternate-sources> <value>alternate source</value> <type>String</type> </alternate-sources> <alternate-paths> <value>alternate path</value> <type>String</type> </alternate-paths> </element> </alternate> </alternate> <drivers> <type>Array</type> <drivers> <element> <type>Structure</type> <driver-name> <value>driver name</value> <type>String</type> </driver-name> <driver-type> <value>driver type</value> <type>String</type> </driver-type> <driver-description> <value>driver description</value> <type>String</type> </driver-description> <driver-version> <value>driver version</value> <type>String</type> </driver-version> </element> </drivers> </drivers> <sysmodtime> <value>2008.11.12 14:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <sysmoduser> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> <sysmodcount> <value>6</value> <type>Decimal</type> </sysmodcount> </main-frame>
<file-facility> <type>Structure</type> <logical-name> <value>file logical name</value> <type>String</type> </logical-name> <contact-name> <value>file contact name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <primary-phone> <value>file primary phone</value> <type>String</type> </primary-phone> <building> <value>file building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <floor> <value>file floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <install-date> <value>2007.11.12 14:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </install-date> <manufacturer> <value>file manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </manufacturer> <alternate-id> <value>file alternate id</value> <type>String</type> </alternate-id> <network-address> <value>file network address</value> <type>String</type> </network-address> <network-parent> <value>file network parent</value> <type>String</type> </network-parent> <local-software> <type>Array</type> <local-software> <element> <value>file locaal software line 1</value> </remote-software> </remote-software> <controlling-software> <type>Array</type> <controlling-software> <element> <value>file controlling software line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>file controlling software line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </controlling-software> </controlling-software> <feature-id> <type>Array</type> <feature-id> <element> </element> </feature-description> </feature-description> <feature-vendor> <type>Array</type> <feature-vendor> <element> <value>file feature vendor line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>file feature vendor line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </feature-vendor> </feature-vendor> <comments> <type>Array</type> <comments> <element> <value>file comments line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>file comments line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </comments> </comments> <device-type> <value>file device type</value> <type>String</type> </device-type> <ipx-address> <value>file ipx address</value> <type>String</type> </ipx-address> <mac-address> <value>file mac address</value> <type>String</type> </mac-address> <gateway> <value>file gateway</value> <type>String</type> </gateway> <subnet-mask> <value>file subnet mask</value> <type>String</type> </subnet-mask> <feature-size> <type>Array</type> <feature-size> <element> <value>file feature size line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>file feature size line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </feature-size> </feature-size> </sw-name> </sw-name> <sw-version> <type>Array</type> <sw-version> <element> <value>file sw version line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>file sw version line 2</value> <hard-disc> <value>file hard disc</value> <type>String</type> </hard-disc> <cpu-type> <value>file cpu type</value> <type>String</type> </cpu-type> <monitor> <value>file monitor</value> <type>String</type> </monitor> <video> <value>file video</value> <type>String</type> </video> <nic> <value>file nic</value> <type>String</type> </nic> <updated-by> <value>file updated by</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by>
<event-updated> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </event-updated> <sysmodtime> <value>2007.11.12 14:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <bios> <value>file bios</value> <type>String</type> </bios> <sc-manufacturer> <value>file sc manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </sc-manufacturer> <model-ext> <value>file model ext</value> <type>String</type> </model-ext> <sysmodcount> <value>0</value> <type>Decimal</type> </sysmodcount> <sysmoduser> <value>file Systemod user</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> </file-facility> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description: Instance [Required] : The elements provided in the instance element refer to particular field of the record. We create an instance of this record by providing information in the <value> elements.
NOTE: The elements provided in <keys> element doesn’t mean that we are asking the application that these elements (the elements in the <keys> element) should be treated as keys for the record being created. Application has pre-defined key elements. The elements given in the <keys> element are meaning-less.
Complete Elements’ Description:
NOTE: To create a ‘Main Frame’ record, we require at least <configuration-item> and <configuration-item-type> elements to be populated properly. See the bold elements in this “Elements’ Description”.
NOTE: The element <configuration-item> is used as key. Thus this field must be populated with unique string.
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>create-main-frame</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
configuration-item [Required]: This is the name of the record. It must be unique as it’s used as key as well.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Configuration Item.”
Valid Values: Any unique string.
Default Value: I’ts a required element. So, not default value.
Vendor [Optional]: The vendor name.
Name of this element in the application: “Vendor > Vendor Name.”
Valid Values: Any string or you can select vendor record from the application’s repository.
Default Value: ““
Parent-device[Optional]: The parent device name
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: ““
Model [Optional]: the model of the furnishing.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: ““
Serial-number [Optional]: The serial number of the record.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Serial Number.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: ““
Location [Optional]: location mapped by the record.
Name of this element in the application: “Location > Location.”
Valid Values: Any String or you can select any existing location record.
Default Value: ““
Configuration-item-type[Required]: the type of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: When we create any configuration item then at beginning level we’re asked for the type of configuration item. We have to select one of them. Like if we want to create display device then we should select that one. Other example might be computer, telecommunication device etc.
Also note that, these subtype are customizable. You can create new configuration item type in through the application.
Valid Values: Mainframe
Default Value: No default value, as it’s required field.
Note: if you’re creating “Main Frame” then you must populate this element with “mainframe”.
Updated-by [Optional] : the name of the person that has updated the record.
Name of this element in the record: This is hidden field maintained by the record and is not visible to the application’s graphical interface. It has no use in the creation of the record process, but we can use this field during retrieving process.
Valid Values: Any string (during retrieving.)
Default Value: This field is maintained by the application, user need not to give this input. The application inserts the user-name who is using the web-service.
Contact-name [Optional]: the contact name.
Name of this element in the record: “Contact > Contact Name.”
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default value: ““
Part-number [Optional]: the part number.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Part Number”
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default value: ““
Status[Optional] : the status of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Status”
Valid Values: Any one string out of following set of strings
Installed Available Warehouse Transfer RMA Replaced Reserved Retired
Default Value: ““
configuration-item-sub-type [Optional] : The subtype for a selected configuration item type.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Subtype.”
Valid Values: this is customizable and we can add/delete more subtypes. Currently there are following subtypes for the “computer” configuration item type.
Controller Host CPU FEP NCP LPAR
Location-code[Optional]: The code for the location.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: ““
Building [Optional]: The building.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Building. Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Floor[Optional]: The floor related to the location.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Floor.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Room[Optional]: the room information.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Room.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
System-down[Optional]: this tell whether the system is down or not.
Name of this element in the application: the field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: true/ false. True -> system is down, false -> system is not down.
Default Value: false.
Asset-tag [Optional]: the asset tag for the record.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Asset Tag.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Critical[Optional]: this tell whether the record is critical or not.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > Critical CI (Radio Buttorn) Valid Values: true/ false.
True -> record is critical. False -> record is not critical.
Default value: false.
Company[Optional]: Company name.
Name of this field in the application: Company.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Department[Optional]: the department information.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Department.”
Valid Value: any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Default Value: “”
Assignment-group[Optional]: the assignment group.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Assignment.”
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Default Value: “”
Addl[Optional]: Note: all the successor elemens of this element are NON-EXISTING.
The children of this elements keep information of other (additional) components.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional”
Valid Values: as it’s array type, it must be structure in following manner-
<addl> <type>array</type> <addl> <!— children keeps information > </addl> </addl>
Default Value: in case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor to this would be keep blank.
Addl > addl [Optional] : information for additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “components > Additional.”
Valid Values: this element has many children each must have name <element> (except metadata element <type>) otherwise they will simply be ignored during creation of the record process.
Default Value: In case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor of it would be kept blank.
Addl-manufacturer[optional] : The name of manufacturer who had made the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Manufacturer.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Addl-name [Optional] : the name of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Name”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Addl-type [Optional]: the type of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Type.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Addl-description[Optional] : the description of the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Description.”
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: “” Scans [Optional:
Note: all the successor elements of this element NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
NOTE: each element show one row.
Scan-date [Optional] : The scan date.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > Date”
Valid Values: Any input in datetime format.
Default value: “”
Scan-type [Optional] : the type of scan.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > type.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Scan-version: The version information of the scanner.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > version.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
Scan-result[Optional]: The scan result.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > Scan Result.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”.
Support-contacts [Optional]: : It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
support-contact-name [Optional] : The name of support contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Contact Name.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”.
Support-contact-reason [Optional] : the reason field in the contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > reason.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Support-contact-first [Optional] : A field for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > First Name.”
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Support-contact-last [Optional]: A filed for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Last Name.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Support-contact-phone [Optional]: the phone number for the contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Phone No.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Support-contact-email [Optional]: the email id information for the contact.
Name of this field in the application: “Contact > E-mail.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
Feature [Optional] :
Note: all the successor elements of this element are NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Feature-id [optional]: the feature id.
Name of this field in the application: the field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Feature-size [optional]: feature size.
Name of this field in the application: The field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any decimal value.
Default Value: “”
Feature-description [optional]: the description of the feature.
Name of this element in the application: the field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Main-frame[Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Configuration-item [Optional]: see configuration-item given above.
Alternates [Optional]:
Note: all the successor elements of this element are NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Alternate-source [Optional]: the alternate source.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Alternate-paths[Optional]: the alternate paths.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Drivers[Optional]:
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Driver-name[Optional]: The driver’s name.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Name
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Driver-type[Optional]: The driver’s type.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Type
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Driver-description[Optional]: The driver’s description.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Description
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Driver-version[Optional]: The driver’s version.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Version
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
Sysmodtime [Optional]: (NOT writable)The system time.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
It’s maintained by application itself. If user provides input to this element, it simply gets ignored.
Sysmoduser [Optional]: The system user.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
It’s maintained by application itself. If user provides input to this element, it simply gets ignored.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: some count.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
It’s maintained by application itself. If user provides input to this element, it simply gets ignored.
File-facility [Required]: The file structure associated with mainframe. Note this is a structure type of element, whose children describe the file facility.
Note: All the successor elements (children, grand-children etc) of this element are hidden to hp-service-center client UI application.
Logical-name [Optional]: (NOT writable) the logical name.
It’s referring to “configuration-item” field/element of “device” field/element.
Contact-name[Optional]: (NOT writable) the contact name.
It’s referring to “contact-name” field/element of “device” field/element.
Primary-phone [Optional]: the primary phone.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Building [Optional]: (NOT writable) the building information.
It’s referring to “building” field/element of “device” field/element.
Floor [Optional]: (NOT writable) the floor information.
It’s referring to “floor” field/element of “device” field/element.
Alternate-id [Optional]: the alternate id.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Network-parent [Optional]: The parent network.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Local-software [Optional]: the local software. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of local-software.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Remote-software [Optional]: the remote software. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of remote-software.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
controlling-software [Optional]: the controlling software. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of controlling-software.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Feature-id [Optional]: the feature ID. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of feature-id.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
feature-description [Optional]: the feature description. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of feature-description.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Feature-vendor [Optional]: the feature vendor. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of feature-vendor.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Device-type [Optional]: (NOT writable) the device-type information.
It’s referring to “configuration-item” field/element of “device” field/element.
Ipx-address [Optional]: the ipx address.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Gateway [Optional]: the gateway information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Feature-size [Optional]: the feature size. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of feature-size.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Sw-name [Optional]: the software name. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of sw-name.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Sw-version[Optional]: the software version. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of sw-version.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Sw-vendor [Optional]: the software vendor. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of sw-vendor.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Sw-install [Optional]: the software install information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: one entry of sw-install.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Ram [Optional]: the ram information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: field doesn’t get created.
Hard-disc [Optional]: the hard disc information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Cpu-type [Optional]: the type of CPU.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Monitor [Optional]: the monitor information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Video [Optional]: the video information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Nic [Optional]: the inc information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Updated-by [Optional]: (NOT writable) the updated by information.
It’s referring to “updated-by” field/element of “device” field/element.
Event-updated [Optional]: (NOT writable) the information if there was some update.
It’s maintained by application. It keeps information whether the record was updated. It’s Boolean type.
True -> if the record was updated.
False -> if the record was not updated.
Sysmodtime [Optional]: (NOT writable) the sysmod time.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
It’s maintained by application itself. If user provides input to this element, it simply gets ignored.
Bios [Optional]: the BIOS information of the file system .
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Sc-manufacturer [Optional]: the sc manufacturer.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Model-ext [Optional]: the model ext.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any string.
Default value: field doesn’t get created.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: (NOT writable) the sysmod count.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
It’s maintained by application itself. If user provides input to this element, it simply gets ignored.
Sysmoduser [Optional]: (NOT writable) the sysmod user.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
It’s maintained by application itself. If user provides input to this element, it simply gets ignored.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Create Main Frame
This wrapper creates ‘Main Frame’ record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
